name: NEW!!! A Wayfarer's Lament (CD)
description:
Release in December 2012, A Wayfarer's Lament is a chapter on lifes beginnings, endings, and the hope  that shines through it all. Uplifting honest songs that go deep. Simple arrangements create a beautifully sparse room of sound and soul. Featuring many of the same musicians as on Tex Smith, and To a Bird Singing Woe, A Wayfarer's Lament follows the first two like Part 3 of a story. All original songs, written and produced in Austin Texas by Tex Smith along with Brother Machine. A great follow up to his first two records, you will want all 3.

TRACKS:
1.	I Wanna Go Home
2.	Was It Something That I Said
3.	A Wayfarer's Lament
4.	Only the Lost Lovers
5.	Better Days Are Due
6.	Looks Like Sunshine
7.	There Was a Man
8.	When My Soul Spreads Its Wings
9.	Picture Left Out in the Rain
10.	The Ghost
11.	Nothing New

name: To A Bird Singing Woe (CD)
description:
Also recorded in Austin Texas at Superpop! Studios, Tex Smith’s second release 2010’s To A Bird Singing Woe beautifully takes on lost love and heartbreak face to face. The album features 12 more Tex Smith original songs full of sentiment, sorrow, with a twist of light. To A Bird Singing Woe highlights his growth as a writer and continued development of his unique sound and delivery. In addition to the original cast of players from his debut record, Tex adds in an extra punch to the rhythm section with friends Jake Erwin playing upright bass (Hot Club of Cowtown), and Pete Coatney on drums (Jack Ingram, Deadman). As an added bonus HalleyAnna Finlay (Texas singer-songwriter) makes a guest appearance on the duet “Come On” creating a whole new element and feel to Tex’s recordings. A few other guest artists and friends round out a solid cast of musicians. The end result is a much more crisp, down to the essentials roots record that is sure to make you cry, laugh, and tap your feet; it’s a solid effort all the way through. To A Bird Singing Woe was recorded in the Spring/Summer of 2010 in Austin, TX. Its a more stripped down acoustic record than the debut "Tex Smith". Loss, redemption, and remembering the good times are all common themes on To A Bird Singing Woe.

TRACKS:
1.	I Cant Stand Beautiful Women
2.	Come On
3.	The Little Things
4.	The Future May Never Come
5.	Zuzu's Petals
6.	Star of Bethlehem
7.	He Is Crazy About You
8.	Chains
9.	Avery's Blues
10.	Me And You Blues
11.	Lovely Laura
12.	Used To Be My Favorite Season
13.	Goodbye Songs

name: Tex Smith (CD)
description:
The debut album from Tex Smith. All songs written by Tex. Recorded in the Spring of 2009 in Austin TX at Superpop! Studios (The Archibalds, Leatherbag). The album features musicians Joey Thompson, Seth Gibbs, Pete Stafford, Patrick Goforth and Stephen Brady Dietert. Recorded in 4 studio days, these are simple two and a half minute Country songs played in hi-fi soul by a hanful of musicians that appreciate good music and are just having fun. A genre-less record. If you like John Prine, Everly Brothers, Buddy Holly, Hank Williams, Towne Van Zandt, Tex Smith is for you.

TRACKS
1.  	Foolish Lovesong
2.	Don't Leave Me Now
3.	Amarillo She Did Wear
4.	Let's Be Friends
5.	Something
6.	What Happened To California
7.	Baby, Please Don't Wear Your Party Dress Tonight
8.	Honky Tonk Parades
9.	My Love
10.	Esperanza
11.	Trucker
12.	Before We Arrive
